definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to seem almost genuine/easily mistaken for the real thing

sentences.english: These classic pieces of furniture imitating ancient style almost look genuine.
sentences.chinese: 古色古香的仿古傢俱，簡直可以亂真。

sentences.english: Many fake the real thing, merchants can not see through at once.
sentences.chinese: 許多假貨可以亂真，商家無法一下子識破。

sentences.english: Styles have become more varied, from broadly cartoonish to almost photo-realistic.
sentences.chinese: 風格更爲多樣，從寬廣的卡通風格到幾乎與照片亂真。

sentences.english: Care must be exercised to prevent thermal strains from introducing spurious output.
sentences.chinese: 必須注意防止熱應變引起亂真輸出。

sentences.english: The shape and the color make the "eye-stickers" look realistic.
sentences.chinese: 其形狀和顏色與人眼十分接近，可以以假亂真。
